articles.author: ERIC TUCKER, FARNOUSH AMIRI, REBECCA SANTANA and CLAUDIA LAUER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Secret Service's acting director told lawmakers on Tuesday that he considered it indefensible that the roof used by the gunman in the attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump was unsecured, faulting local law enforcement for not circulating urgent information ahead of the shooting and for not adequately protecting the scene.
articles.title: Acting Secret Service director says he's 'ashamed' after the Trump assassination attempt

articles.author: BASSEM MROUE and TIA GOLDENBERG
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — Israel's military said Tuesday it carried out a strike on Beirut targeting the militant commander allegedly behind the deaths of 12 children and teens in a rocket attack on the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights over the weekend.
articles.title: Israel says it has struck Beirut, targeting the commander accused in deaths of 12 youth in Golan

articles.author: JOSHUA GOODMAN and REGINA GARCIA CANO
articles.description: CARACAS, Venezuela (AP) — As thousands of people demonstrated across Venezuela, opposition candidate Edmundo González announced Monday that his campaign has the proof it needs to show he won the country's disputed election in which electoral authorities named President Nicolás Maduro the victor.
articles.title: Venezuelan opposition says it has proof its candidate defeated President Maduro in disputed election

articles.author: BILL BARROW and STEVE PEOPLES
articles.description: AMBLER, Pa. (AP) — Democrat Josh Shapiro had a dual message for enthusiastic voters in suburban Philadelphia this week, telling them Kamala Harris belongs in the White House — and then reminding them of all he’s done as governor of battleground Pennsylvania.
articles.title: The Democratic contest to be Harris' running mate will likely be decided in the next week

articles.author: MICHELLE L. PRICE
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Donald Trump seems to be backing away from his earlier commitment to debate Vice President Kamala Harris, questioning the value of a meetup and saying he “probably” will debate but he “can also make a case for not doing it” — prompting her campaign to say he's “scared.”
articles.title: Trump says he 'probably' will debate Harris but can 'make a case for not.' Her team says he's scared

articles.author: NADIA LATHAN
articles.description: AUSTIN, Texas (AP) — Meta has agreed to a $1.4 billion settlement with Texas in a privacy lawsuit over allegations that the tech giant used biometric data of users without their permission, officials said Tuesday.
articles.title: Meta agrees to $1.4B settlement with Texas in privacy lawsuit over facial recognition

articles.author: JILL LAWLESS and BRIAN MELLEY
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — Three young girls killed in a stabbing rampage at a Taylor Swift-themed dance and yoga class in northwestern England were identified Tuesday as police questioned the 17-year-old suspect arrested in the attack that wounded 10 others.
articles.title: 3 girls killed in stabbing at Taylor Swift-themed UK dance class. 7 people still critically wounded

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Since Russia invaded Ukraine in 2022, President Vladimir Putin and other Kremlin voices have frequently threatened the West with its nuclear arsenal.
articles.title: Putin often cites Russia’s 'nuclear doctrine' governing the use of atomic weapons. But what is it?

articles.author: WILL GRAVES
articles.description: PARIS (AP) — It is not enough — it has never been enough — for Simone Biles to do gymnastics.The 27-year-old American star has been intent almost from the start on pushing the sport in new directions by doing things that have never been done before.
articles.title: Simone Biles has redefined her sport -- and its vocabulary. A look at the skills bearing her name

articles.author: PAT GRAHAM and KATE BRUMBACK
articles.description: PARIS (AP) — Olympics organizers are banking on the sun and scorching temperatures to improve the water quality of the Seine River enough for triathletes to swim in it.Otherwise, they could be feeling the heat.
articles.title: Men’s Olympic triathlon postponed in Paris over Seine water quality concerns
